Fun but a few things should be corrected. The app should allow us to select "custom rules" while playing multiplayer, only allows that when you select the "online with friends" mode. Next, I cant play with other random players when i select the "online friends" mode. Also, we should be allowed to chat in game, there's only a drop-down of selected texts that we can choose from. And, we should be able to add random players as friends with just their name instead of needing a code.

This is a dishonest attempt to separate you from your money. An honest approach to selling the game would be to offer some number of levels for free. A gamer could then decide whether the game is worthy of purchase and buy it once. As it is, the game play encourages frustration to try and trigger a spending impulse. The open ended game structure is meant to keep a player paying and paying and paying. Stay away from this one.

Amending my previous positive review. Climbing was doable before. Currently, the duo lane has either Tristana or Caitlin for adcs. Everyone else gets stomped. Was on a 5 game lose streak trying to figure out what I was doing wrong. Then, I got placed in the infamous "playing above your rank" queue against a bunch of masters as an emerald. If I'm playing above my rank, why am I losing? I am sitting on 42% win rate while getting put in "playing above my rank" every 3-5 games.

The good: The game and all the minigames are fun to play for months. The developers keep expanding the game. The bad: It turns into an idle/login game grindfest for weeks or months at a time once you get past the first 15 or so levels. The ugly: The ad removal battle pass is a 2 week subscription service, costs more than most other games, and can't be purchased with in-game currency. If you spend over $50 on a mobile game, you shouldn't ever have to watch ads again.

This used to be my favorite casual game. For years, I would play when I felt like it (sometimes hours at a time), then take a break for a while, before picking up where I left off. Now, if I go away mid-game, when I come back, it shows me game over despite not having lost by backing myself into a corner. I have to start over from scratch. It starts a new game, new score, but because it starts by wiping out my previous progress, I already feel like I don't want to play. Because what's the point?

Runs great on my Pixel 3 XL. Just finished a playthrough. The only bug I encountered was the pause button during combat. When I suspended the app while paused, froze the whole game. Simple fix: don't use in-game pause. Just minimize the app. Otherwise, it's an excellent port. I highly recommend for JRPG gamers.

It can be hard to play a game all at once so it's nice you can pause games whenever, then take them out when you want to continue. The good: The game and all the minigames are fun to play for months. The developers keep expanding the game. The bad: It turns into an idle/login game grindfest for weeks or months at a time once you get past the first 15 or so levels. The ugly: The ad removal battle pass is a 2 week subscription service, costs more than most other games, and can't be purchased with in-game currency. If you spend over $50 on a mobile game, you shouldn't ever have to watch ads again.
